question: 黒人
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>black</kanji> <kanji>person</kanji> is simply a <vocabulary>black person</vocabulary>, kind of like how a <ja>白人</ja> is a "white person," but a different  color.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Imagine a <vocabulary>black person</vocabulary> you know well wearing <reading>coke</reading> <reading>jean</reading>s (<ja>こくじん</ja>). Yep, jeans made entirely from coke bottles. That's actually a thing. Look it up if you don't believe me.
